channel.title: Hindustan Times - topnews
channel.description: News Headlines: Hindustan Times provides exclusive top stories of the day, today headlines from politics, business, technology, photos, videos, latest English news and much more
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2020 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: I'm getting my boobs out: Chrissy Teigen's controversial home coronavirus test was...
item.description: Sharing a black and white topless photo of herself with white hearts covering her nipples as she crouches while laughing, the mother of two wrote, “All good. I’ll still have boobs, they’ll just be pure fat. Which is all a tit is in the first place. A dumb, miraculous bag of fat.”

item.title: 'Crawl towards your goals': How Rebel Wilson aims to slim down to 75 kg for her...
item.description: Hollywood’s Rebel Wilson, comedian and actor seems to be making the most of the coronavirus lockdown and her time in self-isolation by trying to get healthier, and is all set to bring her weight down to 75kgs by the end of this year according to her latest Instagram post.

item.title: Despicable Me's Gru and Minions share tips on social distancing, fun at home in...
item.description: Gru and his band of Minions are urging people to keep their distance to help fight the spread of the novel coronavirus in a new public service announcement unveiled on Wednesday. The movie’s animation studio, Illumination developed the PSA with the WHO and the United Nations Foundation.

item.title: Here's how coronavirus enters cells by evading immune system, may help develop new...
item.description: Scientists have identified features of the novel coronavirus which enable it to efficiently enter cells, while stealthily evading surveillance by the host immune system, findings that may lead to novel drug targets against COVID-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Universally effective antibodies found in Covid-19 survivors, may help...
item.description: A study of 149 people who recovered from COVID-19 shows that most individuals had generated at least some antibodies that were intrinsically capable of neutralising the SARS-CoV-2 virus, scientists say.

item.title: Norwegian Wood author Haruki Murakami DJs 'Stay Home' radio show to lift spirits...
item.description: Acclaimed Japanese novelist Haruki Murakami, hosting a special radio show from home, painted a brighter side of the world with his favourite music, and said the fight against the coronavirus is a challenge in figuring out ways to help and care for each other.

item.title: Scarred for life: 'Lockdown generation' looms as coronavirus pandemic risks robbing...
item.description: A study by the U.N.’s International Labour Organization pointed to the “multiple shocks” young people now faced worldwide - losing work, education and training, income and the possibility of either finding or changing jobs. The impact is even worse for young women.

item.title: HT Exclusive: Nudged by Ajit Doval, Myanmar army hands over 22 northeast insurg...
item.description: The handling over anti-India insurgents by Myanmar military is a culmination of months of work by NSA Ajit Doval and security agencies

item.title: Govt to create Rs 1 lakh crore Agri-Infrastructure Fund for marginalised farmers:...
item.description: The lack of adequate cold chain and post-harvest management in the vicinity of farm-gate is causing gaps in value chains. The government’s focus has been on short-term crop loans while investment in long-term agriculture infrastructure has often not been enough, the minister indicated.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi jabs NITI Aayog over Covid-19 'prediction'; gets a prompt rebuttal
item.description: NITI Aayog chief executive officer Amitabh Kant later tweeted his rebuttal to Rahul Gandhi.

item.title: Delhi's Covid-19 death toll rises to123, city reports 425 fresh cases taking tally...
item.description: In a health bulletin issued on Friday, the Delhi health department said, the death toll from the coronavirus infection in the national capital has risen to 123. The national capital, however, did not report any deaths due to coronavirus in the last twenty-four hours, the data revealed.

item.title: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma could remain stranded in Mumbai when India return to training,...
item.description: Speaking in an interview to news agency AFP, BCCI treasurer Arun Dhumal said: “For players like Kohli and Rohit, the restrictions are there in Mumbai and might stay.”

item.title: 'My child has been crying, please let me go home': Migrant worker breaks down
England spinner picks Babar Azam over Virat Kohli, gives reason for his choice
item.description: Rashid went ahead and picked the Pakistani middle order batsman over Kohli but clarified that his choice was based on current form.
